help.short: The virtual network (VNet) name.
Expands referenced resources. Default value is None.
The virtual network (VNet) name.
The virtual network (VNet) name.
The extended location of the virtual network.
The name of the extended location.
The type of the extended location.
Resource location.
Space-separated list of IP address prefixes for the VNet. Default: 10.0.0.0/16. If provided, --ipam-allocations should not be specified.
The BGP community associated with the virtual network.
Name or ID of a DDoS protection plan to associate with the VNet.
Space-separated list of DNS server IP addresses.
Control whether DDoS protection is enabled.
Enable VM protection for all subnets in the VNet.
Enable encryption on the virtual network.
To control if the Virtual Machine without encryption is allowed in encrypted Virtual Network or not.
The FlowTimeout value (in minutes) for the Virtual Network.
Private Endpoint VNet Policies.
Space-separated tags: key[=value] [key[=value] ...].
A list of IPAM Pools allocating IP address prefixes. If provided, --address-prefixes would be ignored and should not be specified.
Number of IP addresses to allocate.
Resource id of the associated Azure IpamPool resource.
Resource ID.
Array of IpAllocation which reference this VNET.
A list of peerings in a Virtual Network.
Resource ID.
The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group. This name can be used to access the resource.
Whether the forwarded traffic from the VMs in the local virtual network will be allowed/disallowed in remote virtual network.
If gateway links can be used in remote virtual networking to link to this virtual network.
Whether the VMs in the local virtual network space would be able to access the VMs in remote virtual network space.
If we need to verify the provisioning state of the remote gateway.
Whether only Ipv6 address space is peered for subnet peering.
The local address space of the local virtual network that is peered.
A list of address blocks reserved for this virtual network in CIDR notation.
A list of IPAM Pools allocating IP address prefixes.
List of local subnet names that are subnet peered with remote virtual network.
The current local address space of the local virtual network that is peered.
Whether complete virtual network address space is peered.
The status of the virtual network peering.
The peering sync status of the virtual network peering.
The reference to the address space peered with the remote virtual network.
The reference to the remote virtual network's Bgp Communities.
The BGP community associated with the virtual network.
List of remote subnet names from remote virtual network that are subnet peered.

The reference to the remote virtual network. The remote virtual network can be in the same or different region (preview). See here to register for the preview and learn more (https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-network/virtual-network-create-peering).
The reference to the current address space of the remote virtual network.

If remote gateways can be used on this virtual network. If the flag is set to true, and allowGatewayTransit on remote peering is also true, virtual network will use gateways of remote virtual network for transit. Only one peering can have this flag set to true. This flag cannot be set if virtual network already has a gateway.
Resource type.
Manage a list of subnets in a Virtual Network (similar to `az network vnet subnet`).
Resource ID.
The subnet name.
The address prefix for the subnet.
List of address prefixes for the subnet.
Application gateway IP configurations of virtual network resource.
Resource ID.
Name of the IP configuration that is unique within an Application Gateway.
Reference to the subnet resource. A subnet from where application gateway gets its private address.

Set this property to false to disable default outbound connectivity for all VMs in the subnet. This property can only be set at the time of subnet creation and cannot be updated for an existing subnet.
An array of references to the delegations on the subnet.
Resource ID.
The name of the resource that is unique within a subnet. This name can be used to access the resource.
The name of the service to whom the subnet should be delegated (e.g. Microsoft.Sql/servers).
Resource type.
Array of IpAllocation which reference this subnet.
A list of IPAM Pools for allocating IP address prefixes.
Nat gateway associated with this subnet.
Resource ID.
The reference to the NetworkSecurityGroup resource.
Resource ID.
Resource location.
When enabled, flows created from Network Security Group connections will be re-evaluated when rules are updates. Initial enablement will trigger re-evaluation.
A collection of security rules of the network security group.
Resource ID.
The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group. This name can be used to access the resource.
The network traffic is allowed or denied.
A description for this rule. Restricted to 140 chars.

The destination address prefix. CIDR or destination IP range. Asterisk '*' can also be used to match all source IPs. Default tags such as 'VirtualNetwork', 'AzureLoadBalancer' and 'Internet' can also be used.
The destination address prefixes. CIDR or destination IP ranges.
The application security group specified as destination.
The destination port or range. Integer or range between 0 and 65535. Asterisk '*' can also be used to match all ports.
The destination port ranges.
The direction of the rule. The direction specifies if rule will be evaluated on incoming or outgoing traffic.

The priority of the rule. The value can be between 100 and 4096. The priority number must be unique for each rule in the collection. The lower the priority number, the higher the priority of the rule.
Network protocol this rule applies to.

The CIDR or source IP range. Asterisk '*' can also be used to match all source IPs. Default tags such as 'VirtualNetwork', 'AzureLoadBalancer' and 'Internet' can also be used. If this is an ingress rule, specifies where network traffic originates from.
The CIDR or source IP ranges.
The application security group specified as source.
Resource ID.
Resource location.
Resource tags.
The source port or range. Integer or range between 0 and 65535. Asterisk '*' can also be used to match all ports.
The source port ranges.
The type of the resource.
Resource tags.
Disable private endpoint network policies on the subnet, the policy is disabled by default.
Disable private link service network policies on the subnet.
The reference to the RouteTable resource.
Resource ID.
Resource location.
Whether to disable the routes learned by BGP on that route table. True means disable.
Collection of routes contained within a route table.
Resource ID.
The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group. This name can be used to access the resource.
The destination CIDR to which the route applies.
The IP address packets should be forwarded to. Next hop values are only allowed in routes where the next hop type is VirtualAppliance.
The type of Azure hop the packet should be sent to.
The type of the resource.
Resource tags.
An array of service endpoint policies.
Resource ID.
Resource location.
A collection of contextual service endpoint policy.
The alias indicating if the policy belongs to a service
A collection of service endpoint policy definitions of the service endpoint policy.
Resource ID.
The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group. This name can be used to access the resource.
A description for this rule. Restricted to 140 chars.
Service endpoint name.
A list of service resources.
The type of the resource.
Resource tags.
An array of service endpoints.
A list of locations.
SubResource as network identifier.
The type of the endpoint service.

Set this property to Tenant to allow sharing subnet with other subscriptions in your AAD tenant. This property can only be set if defaultOutboundAccess is set to false, both properties can only be set if subnet is empty.
Resource type.
The virtual network (VNet) name.
Space-separated list of IP address prefixes for the VNet. Default: 10.0.0.0/16. If provided, --ipam-allocations should not be specified.
The BGP community associated with the virtual network.
Name or ID of a DDoS protection plan to associate with the VNet.
Space-separated list of DNS server IP addresses.
Control whether DDoS protection is enabled.
Enable VM protection for all subnets in the VNet.
Enable encryption on the virtual network.
To control if the Virtual Machine without encryption is allowed in encrypted Virtual Network or not.
The FlowTimeout value (in minutes) for the Virtual Network.
Private Endpoint VNet Policies.
A list of IPAM Pools allocating IP address prefixes. If a non-empty value is provided, --address-prefixes would be ignored.
Number of IP addresses to allocate.
Resource id of the associated Azure IpamPool resource.
The extended location of the virtual network.
The name of the extended location.
The type of the extended location.
Resource ID.
Resource location.
Resource tags.
Array of IpAllocation which reference this VNET.
A list of subnets in a Virtual Network.

The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group. This name can be used to access the resource.
The address prefix for the subnet.
List of address prefixes for the subnet.
Application gateway IP configurations of virtual network resource.
Resource ID.
Name of the IP configuration that is unique within an Application Gateway.
Reference to the subnet resource. A subnet from where application gateway gets its private address.

Set this property to false to disable default outbound connectivity for all VMs in the subnet. This property can only be set at the time of subnet creation and cannot be updated for an existing subnet.
An array of references to the delegations on the subnet.
Resource ID.
The name of the resource that is unique within a subnet. This name can be used to access the resource.
The name of the service to whom the subnet should be delegated (e.g. Microsoft.Sql/servers).
Resource type.
Array of IpAllocation which reference this subnet.
A list of IPAM Pools for allocating IP address prefixes.
Nat gateway associated with this subnet.
Resource ID.

Resource location.

A collection of security rules of the network security group.

The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group. This name can be used to access the resource.
The network traffic is allowed or denied.
A description for this rule. Restricted to 140 chars.

The destination address prefix. CIDR or destination IP range. Asterisk '*' can also be used to match all source IPs. Default tags such as 'VirtualNetwork', 'AzureLoadBalancer' and 'Internet' can also be used.
The destination address prefixes. CIDR or destination IP ranges.
The application security group specified as destination.
The destination port or range. Integer or range between 0 and 65535. Asterisk '*' can also be used to match all ports.
The destination port ranges.
The direction of the rule. The direction specifies if rule will be evaluated on incoming or outgoing traffic.

The priority of the rule. The value can be between 100 and 4096. The priority number must be unique for each rule in the collection. The lower the priority number, the higher the priority of the rule.
Network protocol this rule applies to.

The CIDR or source IP range. Asterisk '*' can also be used to match all source IPs. Default tags such as 'VirtualNetwork', 'AzureLoadBalancer' and 'Internet' can also be used. If this is an ingress rule, specifies where network traffic originates from.
The CIDR or source IP ranges.
The application security group specified as source.
Resource ID.
Resource location.
Resource tags.
The source port or range. Integer or range between 0 and 65535. Asterisk '*' can also be used to match all ports.
The source port ranges.
The type of the resource.
Resource tags.
Enable or Disable apply network policies on private end point in the subnet.
Enable or Disable apply network policies on private link service in the subnet.
The reference to the RouteTable resource.
Resource ID.
Resource location.
Whether to disable the routes learned by BGP on that route table. True means disable.
Collection of routes contained within a route table.
Resource ID.
The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group. This name can be used to access the resource.
The destination CIDR to which the route applies.
The IP address packets should be forwarded to. Next hop values are only allowed in routes where the next hop type is VirtualAppliance.
